class.name: LiquidArea
class.brief_description: Represents a planar liquid surface where objects can be submerged.
class.description: The area's transform represents a plane where the liquid is considered to be in the -Y direction. Any Buoyancy system is considered submerged when below the area's origin on the Y axis. Derive and override [method]update_transforms_for_points[/method] to provide a dynamic surface (e.g. waves).

method.name: is_point_submerged
method.description: Returns true if the given global point is considered submerged by the liquid (local Y < 0).

method.name: get_liquid_transform
method.description: Returns the transform of the liquid surface at the given global point. If [method]update_transforms_for_points[/method] is overridden, the override will be used.

method.name: update_transforms_for_points
method.description: Fill the provided transforms array with the liquid surface transform for each global point. Default implementation returns the area's global transform for all points. Override to supply per-point transforms (e.g. waves).

members.member: Bulk current velocity of the liquid in m/s.
